t: And*p Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.
And*p Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
And*p he went on his journeys from the south even to Beth–el, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Beth–el and Ai;
Unto*p the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the Lord.*s
And*p Lot also, which went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
And*p the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
And*p there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram's cattle and the herdmen of Lot's cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.
And*p Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we be brethren.

Is*p not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

And*p Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the Lord*s destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the Lord,*s like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.
Then*p Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.
Abram*p dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward Sodom.
But*p the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the Lord*s exceedingly.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:
For*p all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.
And*p I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.
Arise,*p walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.
Then*p Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the Lord.*s
